summary: This bill, the IVF Access and Affordability Act, proposes an income tax credit for fertility treatments. It amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow eligible individuals, including the taxpayer, their spouse, or dependents, to claim a credit for assisted reproductive technology expenses. The credit is capped at $20,000 (or $40,000 for joint filers) and is subject to income limitations based on adjusted gross income. The bill also includes provisions for carryforwards of unused credits, denial of double benefits, and conforming amendments to the tax code. It would apply to taxable years beginning after the date of enactment.
